description: Number of solutions to y^2 + y = x^3 - x^2 modulo n.
comments: Singh mistakenly called this the L-series, but the L-series for elliptic curve y^2 + y = x^3 - x^2 is A006571. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 20 2010
references: Simon Singh, Fermat's last theorem, 1997 (at the end of ch. 4).
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = sum(x=0, n-1, sum(y=0, n-1, (y^2 + y - x^3 + x^2) % n == 0))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Mar 20 2010 */(PARI) {a(n) = local(E, A, p, e); if(n<1, 0, E = ellinit( [0, -1, 1, 0, 0], 1); A = factor(n); prod( k=1, matsize(A)[1], if(p = A[k, 1], e = A[k, 2]; (p - ellap(E, p)) * p^(e-1) )))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Mar 20 2010 */
author: _Frank Ellermann_, Apr 09 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Apr 13 2001
